        hostMonitoring - New value for the property.

      • setDefaultVmRestartPriority

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setDefaultVmRestartPriority(FailuresAndResponses.RestartPriority defaultVmRestartPriority)
        Restart priority for a virtual machine.

        If not specified at either the cluster level or the virtual machine level, this will default to medium.

        If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        defaultVmRestartPriority - New value for the property.

      • setRestartPriorityConditionTimeout

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setRestartPriorityConditionTimeout(java.lang.Long restartPriorityConditionTimeout)
        This setting is used to specify a maximum time the lower priority VMs should wait for the higher priority VMs to be ready. If the higher priority Vms are not ready by this time, then the lower priority VMs are restarted irrespective of the VM ready state. This timeout can be used to prevent the failover of lower priority VMs to be stuck infinitely. Timeout specified in seconds. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM. setting.

        If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        restartPriorityConditionTimeout - New value for the property.

      • setAdditionalDelay

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setAdditionalDelay(java.lang.Long additionalDelay)
        After condition has been met, a mandatory delay before starting the next VM restart priority.
        Parameters:
        additionalDelay - New value for the property.

      • setHostIsolationResponse

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setHostIsolationResponse(FailuresAndResponses.IsolationResponse hostIsolationResponse)
        Indicates whether or not the virtual machine should be powered off if a host determines that it is isolated from the rest of the compute resource.

        If not specified at either the cluster level or the virtual machine level, this will default to powerOff.

        If null or empty, the value is skipped.
        Parameters:
        hostIsolationResponse - New value for the property.

      • setResponseRecovery

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setResponseRecovery(FailuresAndResponses.VmReactionOnAPDCleared responseRecovery)
        Action taken by VM Component Protection service for a powered on VM when APD condition clears after APD timeout.

        This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are specified by FailuresAndResponses.VmReactionOnAPDCleared. The default value is VmReactionOnAPDCleared#none for cluster setting and VmReactionOnAPDCleared#useClusterDefault for per-VM setting.

        Parameters:
        responseRecovery - New value for the property.

      • setResponseDelay

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setResponseDelay(java.lang.Long responseDelay)
        The time interval after an APD timeout has been declared and before VM Component Protection service will terminate the VM. The default value is 180 seconds if not specified. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM setting.
        Parameters:
        responseDelay - New value for the property.

      • setVmMonitoring

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setVmMonitoring(FailuresAndResponses.VmMonitoringState vmMonitoring)
        Parameters:
        vmMonitoring - New value for the property.

      • setVmToolsMonitoringSettings

        public FailuresAndResponses.Builder setVmToolsMonitoringSettings(VmToolsMonitoringSettings vmToolsMonitoringSettings)
        Parameters:
        vmToolsMonitoringSettings - New value for the property.
